Scaling Factors for Hidden Markov Models

Inference for hidden Markov models (HMMs) is numerically unstable. $d$ $e^{2}$ A standard approach to resolving this instability is to use scaling factors. I discuss this idea in detail.

Published

06 February 2023

This works exactly the same as obsidian $x$ and $y$ $e = mc^2.$

$e = mc^2. \tag{1}$
